verses.roman:
ājñā-pālane kṛṣṇera yaiche paritoṣa
preme ājñā bhāṅgile haya koṭi-sukha-poṣa

synonyms: ājñā-pālane—by carrying out the order; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; yaiche—as; paritoṣa—happiness; preme—in ecstatic love; ājñā bhāṅgile—when one breaks the order; haya—there is; koṭi-sukha-poṣa—millions of times more happiness.
translation: If one carries out Kṛṣṇa's order, Kṛṣṇa is certainly pleased, but if one sometimes breaks His order due to ecstatic love, that gives Him millions of times greater happiness.
